data.text: The 🇬🇧 has left the 🇪🇺. We’re ambitious, confident and optimistic for our future - as masters of our own destiny, and a force for good in the world. https://t.co/cSltXdnzcK

Great to hear that our close friends 🇺🇸🇨🇦🇦🇺 have joined the EU sanctions effort on those who facilitated recent illegal elections in Crimea. By standing together, we send a clear message to Russia that their actions in Crimea are unacceptable. #CrimeaisUkraine

Tonight we leave the EU. Tomorrow, we will reach out to the world as a liberal free trading nation, acting with strong moral anchors, both in our own national interest and as a force for good in the world.

A @foreignoffice plane has landed after evacuating UK & EU nationals from Wuhan. Thanks to FCO staff working round the clock in the 🇬🇧 & 🇨🇳 to get them home. Safety & security of UK nationals is our priority & we will keep working hard to provide help and support

As well as UK nationals we are also bringing Spaniards & other Europeans home on our flight from Wuhan. I want to thank @AranchaGlezLaya & Spanish authorities for your support to help make this evacuation happen 🇬🇧🇪🇸
@ukinspain @HughElliottUK https://t.co/3I8Ha0SF7o
RT @10DowningStreet: Today is the day the UK is leaving the EU. https://t.co/Zuhzl0l5sT
As ever, a hugely constructive discussion with @SecPompeo. Always good to discuss our security cooperation, trade and the special relationship https://t.co/FSY5OlS9CB

Great visit to @EpicGames with @SecPompeo to hear from tech firms working across 🇬🇧🇺🇸. UK received a record £10bn investment in this sector in 2019, with nearly a quarter of this coming from the US. Big opportunities to increase that trade & create more jobs https://t.co/elbryOVDUt

Good meeting with @SecPompeo covering the many future opportunities for the 🇬🇧 & 🇺🇸. We discussed the US Middle East peace plan, Iran & other shared priorities. I underlined our continued commitment to justice for Harry Dunn and his family. https://t.co/8P09FZGVIG

Very moving #HolocaustMemorialDay ceremony in the @foreignoffice with Israeli Ambassador @MarkRegev today. Today, we honour the millions who lost their lives in the Holocaust, pay tribute to those who survived, and pledge to never forget.  https://t.co/2StichDdtT https://t.co/ttkyW2pT4H

Honoured to welcome Eva Schloss MBE to the @foreignoffice today. Eva has dedicated her life to Holocaust remembrance. But we must all learn about the horrors of antisemitism, and renew our pledge to prevent this bleak chapter in human history from ever being repeated https://t.co/smJOCbYzXJ

Looking forward to welcoming @SecPompeo in an historic week for the UK. It’s an opportunity to discuss shared challenges and also look ahead to our future trade relationship and the benefits it will bring to both our economies.

As the inaugural Media Freedom Coalition meeting takes place in Geneva today, I welcome 🇸🇩 🇦🇫 joining our efforts to work towards more a more free and open media and stopping attacks on journalists #DefendMediaFreedom

It is official – after Friday night we will no longer be in the EU. Signing the Instrument of Ratification was a landmark moment. However you voted, let’s look forward together as we chart a new independent, global future for Britain. https://t.co/D7Zl5luh6C

With today’s decision on 5G, we’re establishing one of the toughest regimes for telecoms security in the world while delivering world class connectivity for the UK, as I told Parliament this afternoon.

Due to increasing travel restrictions & public health situation, we now advise against all but essential travel to China. UK govt is urgently working to finalise arrangements for an assisted departure from Hubei Province for British nationals this week https://t.co/jfgE4TDxlp

Today we’ve agreed sanctions with European partners on 7 individuals in Crimea and Sevastopol for undermining Ukraine’s sovereignty. We stand united in condemnation of Russia’s illegal annexation of Crimea #CrimeaisUkraine

https://t.co/8ttGpMwPae
We’re welcoming the best and brightest talent from around the world, so #GlobalBritain is a leading centre for innovation and tech, creating the well-paid jobs of the future. https://t.co/Jb2oPcQNqS

The UK is continuing to work with international partners to deescalate tensions and conflict in the Middle East. Today I had a good first meeting with @FaisalbinFarhan to discuss the challenges facing the region.

We must remember the millions, including from my own family, who
perished in the Holocaust, & educate future generations, so the darkest

We all hope for a swift end to the outbreak and wish Chinese people everywhere a happy new year https://t.co/gsmiQm5sKP

I have just called the US Ambassador to express the Govt’s disappointment about the US extradition decision on Harry Dunn’s case. We feel this amounts to a denial of justice, and that Anne Sacoolas should return to the UK. We are now urgently considering our options.

As I know from my own family’s history, we must never forget those who suffered under Nazi persecution. Today marks the 75th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz, with HRH The Prince of Wales representing the UK at @yadvashem @ukinisrael @ClarenceHouse https://t.co/O2YDQ43oBD
We stand ready to support Lebanon but look to this government to demonstrate its commitment to reform.

The formation of a new government in 🇱🇧 is an important first step. We have consistently called for the urgent formation of an effective and capable government which reflects the aspirations of the Lebanese people.

This week the #UKProsperityFund launches the Customs Modernisation Programme with countries in Southern Africa - removing barriers to trade & creating opportunities for international & British companies. The UK is a proud champion of free trade as a force for good in the world.
🇬🇧 and 🇵🇰 enjoy a strong relationship with plenty of shared interests. Today I had a good discussion with @SMQureshiPTI on shared concerns from Afghanistan and Kashmir to Iran.

Very proud that we are hosting the first UK-Africa Investment Summit. 2020 will be a year to rejuvenate the partnership between the UK and Africa – using trade and investment to boost growth and improve the lives of all our citizens. #InvestInAfrica

We are watching closely to see how Iran responds to the triggering of the Dispute Resolution Mechanism. This is a crucial test of the country’s intentions and we urge Iran to work with us to save the nuclear deal. My statement in @HouseofCommons today: https://t.co/lhcebEESbJ

Updating MPs on why 🇬🇧 🇫🇷 🇩🇪 have today triggered the Dispute Resolution Mechanism in the Iran nuclear deal. We want to keep the deal alive, not extinguish it. If Iran has the will, Britain will use its diplomatic energy to work with allies to chart the way forward

It is vital #Iran never acquires a nuclear weapon. Today, the UK, France and Germany have initiated the dispute resolution mechanism in response to Iran breaking its commitments in the JCPOA nuclear deal. We want to bring Iran back into full compliance and preserve the deal. https://t.co/ptaqGXVerH
